instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHCR_ACIN: What is CHCR_ACIN? This is a typo of CHGR_ACIN When you see CHCR_ACIN, assume they meant to type CHGR_ACIN.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> question
threads.message:
Dear,

No green light. 

I'm measuring on Pin 3 a short to ground. 

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> on the right side:
<SIGNAL>PPCHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> = 16.5

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> on the left side 
<SIGNAL>CHCR_ACIN</SIGNAL> = 0

All other meassures on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> seems fine.
Pin 2 = 16.5
Pin 12 = 3.5 


I guess I need to replaec my ISL. 

right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> question
threads.message:
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> first.
If still short, change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

Please don't use cardinal points in schematic.
No more reference needed, once you write signal name.
You can instead use pin/pad number of a component.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> question
threads.message:
Short still there.

I have to replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

Report back to you when done.
